newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia's NRMA half-year net profit jumps.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia's NRMA half-year net profit jumps.

text.p: Australian general insurer and motorist group NRMA Ltd reported on Thursday a net profit after unrealised gains of A$229.4 million for the six months ended December 31, 1996 compared with A$85.4 million a year earlier.
NRMA said the insurance group posted a net profit after unrealised capital movements for the first half of A$221.2 million, compared with A$78 million a year earlier.
The result before tax and unrealised capital movements improved to a loss of A$177.9 million from a loss A$194.3 million.
Gross written premium rose by 8.3 percent to A$880.7 million for the 1996/97 first half, it said.
"In terms of our future financial performance, we expect the improvements in the underlying business to continue," chief executive officer Malcolm Jones said in a statement.
"There may, however, be some volatility in investment markets, although we remain committed to our long term investment strategy," Jones said.
Jones said NRMA's investment performance had been excellent, reflecting favourable financial market conditions and the repositioning of investment activities in the last two years.
He said storm activity in New South Wales cost the group about A$54 million in home and car insurance claims.
He added a strategic review of NRMA's operations, which started in the middle of 1996, was continuing with a number of new inititives and benefits to be unveiled in the year ahead.
